HTN

  • Dx1
  • Tx
  • HTN Crisis1, 2
    • Dx
    • Tx
  • References

Dx1

Tx

HTN Crisis1, 2

Dx

  • BP > 180/120
  • Evidence of end-organ damage ⇒ emergency, otherwise ⇒ urgency

Tx

Basics of Treatment

  • Urgency
    • Restart or intensify home PO regimine w/ close f/u
  • Emergency
    • IV antihypertensives
    • Target 25% BP decrease in 1hr, then 160/110 in the following 2-6hrs, then normal BP w/i 24-48hrs
    • Pre-/eclampsia, aortic aneurism, and pheochromocytoma have special therapies

References

  1. Whelton PK, Carey RM, Aronow WS, et al. 2017 ACC/AHA/AAPA/ABC/ACPM/AGS/APhA/ASH/ASPC/NMA/PCNA Guideline for the Prevention, Detection, Evaluation, and Management of High Blood Pressure in Adults. Journal of the American College of Cardiology. 2018;71(19):e127-e248. doi:10.1016/j.jacc.2017.11.006 ↩ ↩2

  2. Benken ST. ACCP Hypertensive Emergencies. 2018. Available at: https://www.accp.com/docs/bookstore/ccsap/ccsap2018b1_sample.pdf ↩
